üè† Annotations Filled shapes On this page Filled shapes CodeOpen sandbox Rectangle‚Äã (x1,y1)(x2,y2) CodeOpen sandbox Props‚Äã Mandatory‚Äã x1: first corner horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y1: first corner vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue x2: second corner horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y2: second corner vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue Optional‚Äã color: fill color type: string default: "black" all <rect> svg props are supported for more information visit the documentation Circle‚Äã (x,y)r CodeOpen sandbox Props‚Äã Mandatory‚Äã x: center horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y: center vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue r: circle radius type: ScalarValue Optional‚Äã color: fill color type: string default: "black" all <circle> svg props are supported for more information visit the documentation Ellipse‚Äã (x,y)rxry CodeOpen sandbox Props‚Äã Mandatory‚Äã x: center horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y: center vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue rx: radius on the horizontal axis type: ScalarValue ry: radius on the vertical axis type: ScalarValue Optional‚Äã color: fill color type: string default: "black" all <ellipse> svg props are supported for more information visit the documentation DirectedEllipse‚Äã (x1,y1)(x2,y2)width CodeOpen sandbox Props‚Äã Mandatory‚Äã x1: first corner horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y1: first corner vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue x2: second corner horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y2: second corner vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue width: ellipse width type: ScalarValue Optional‚Äã color: fill color type: string default: "black" all <ellipse> svg props are supported for more information visit the documentation Polygone‚Äã P1P2P3P4P5 CodeOpen sandbox Props‚Äã Mandatory‚Äã points: series of points type: Array<{ x: ScalarValue, y: ScalarValue }> Optional‚Äã color: fill color type: string default: "black" all <polygone> svg props are supported for more information visit the documentation Shape‚Äã CodeOpen sandbox Props‚Äã Mandatory‚Äã x: horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y: vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue size: shape size type: number shape: shape name type: 'triangle' | 'circle' | 'diamond' | 'square' Optional‚Äã color: fill color type: string default: "black" style: customise shape styling type: CSSProperties default: {} onMouseEnter: mouse enter event callback type: MouseEventHandler<SVGGElement> onMouseLeave: mouse leave event callback type: MouseEventHandler<SVGGElement> Edit this page Previous Text Next Other shapes Rectangle Props Circle Props Ellipse Props DirectedEllipse Props Polygone Props Shape Props

üè† Annotations Group On this page Group Group is a container used to group other Annotations Hello, World! CodeOpen sandbox Restriction‚Äã Group must have at least one child Props‚Äã Mandatory‚Äã x: horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y: vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue Optional‚Äã style: customize group children style type: CSSProperties default: {} horizontalAlign: change group horizontal align type: 'start' | 'middle' | 'end' | 'none' default: none verticalAlign: change group vertical align type: 'start' | 'middle' | 'end' | 'none' default: 'none' horizontalAlign='none'Hello!(x,y) horizontalAlign='start'Hello!(x,y) horizontalAlign='middle'Hello!(x,y) horizontalAlign='end'Hello!(x,y) CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Other shapes Next Introduction Restriction Props

üè† Annotations Introduction On this page Introduction react-plot allows adding several elements to our plot, which help us to visualize more data, simplify it, add interaction with the plot... Hello world CodeOpen sandbox Restriction‚Äã Annotations must be inside the Annotation component, they cannot be placed directly inside Plot, otherwise you would get the following error: invalid plot child Annotations‚Äã There is 3 categories each one may containe many annotions : Text Filled shapes Rectangle Circle Ellipse DirectedEllipse Polygone Shape Other shapes Line Arrow Polyline Group Edit this page Previous ParallelAxis Next Text Restriction Annotations

üè† Annotations Other shapes On this page Other shapes CodeOpen sandbox Line‚Äã (x1,y1)(x2,y2) CodeOpen sandbox Props‚Äã Mandatory‚Äã x1: start point horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y1: start point vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue x2: end point horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y2: end point vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue Optional‚Äã color: stroke color type: string default: "black" all <line> svg props are supported for more information visit the documentation Arrow‚Äã startPoint="circle"endPoint="triangle" CodeOpen sandbox same as Line with 2 more special props : startPoint: shape added to starting point type: 'circle' | 'triangle' | 'line' | 'none' default: "none" endPoint: shape added to ending point type: 'circle' | 'triangle' | 'line' | 'none' default: "none" Polyline‚Äã P1P2P3P4P5 CodeOpen sandbox Props‚Äã Mandatory‚Äã points: series of points type: Array<{ x: ScalarValue, y: ScalarValue }> Optional‚Äã color: stroke color type: string default: "black" all <polygone> svg props are supported for more information visit the documentation Edit this page Previous Filled shapes Next Group Line Props Arrow Polyline Props
Markdown page example You don't need React to write simple standalone pages.

üè† Annotations Text On this page Text Text annotation allows adding personlized text to plot in a specifique position Hello world CodeOpen sandbox Props‚Äã Mandatory‚Äã x: horizontal coordinate type: ScalarValue y: vertical coordinate type: ScalarValue Optional‚Äã color: content color type: string default: "black" all <text> svg props are supported for more information visit the documentation Edit this page Previous Introduction Next Filled shapes Props Mandatory Optional

üè† Axes Axis On this page Axis Axis is a component that allow you to add different personalised axes in your Plot CodeOpen sandbox Restriction‚Äã In a Plot, we cannot have two Axis in the same position Example: Adding two bottom axis in the same plot will throw the following error : Plot can only have one bottom axis Props‚Äã 1. Axis Positon‚Äã position: mandatory prop that allow you to choose axis position type: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' CodeOpen sandbox 2. Axis Range‚Äã CodeOpen sandbox min: axis minimum domain value type: number default: calculated automatically based on series data max: axis maximum domain value type: number default: calculated automatically based on series data CodeOpen sandbox paddingStart: added value to range in the beginning of domain type: ScalarValue default: 0 paddingEnd: added value to range in the end of domain type: ScalarValue default: 0 CodeOpen sandbox 3. Identify Axis‚Äã id: value used to identify an axis using a string type: string default:"x" for horizontal axis,"y" for vertical axis CodeOpen sandbox scale: Axis scale type type: 'linear' | 'log' | 'time' default:'linear' CodeOpen sandbox 4. Choose Axis Behaviour‚Äã flip: used to filp axis type: boolean default: false CodeOpen sandbox hidden: Hide all axis elements type: boolean default: false CodeOpen sandbox 5. Personlise Axis‚Äã a. Line‚Äã hiddenLine: Hide axis line type: boolean default: false lineStyle: change line style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox b. Label‚Äã label: Axis label type: ReactNode default: "" labelStyle: change label style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox c. Grid‚Äã displayPrimaryGridLines: add simple grid lines to the plot type: boolean default: false primaryGridLineStyle: customise grid lines style type: CSSProperties default: {} displaySecondaryGridLines: add secondary grid lines to the plot type: boolean default: false secondaryGridLineStyle: change secondary grid lines style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox d. Ticks‚Äã hiddenTicks: Hide axis ticks type: boolean default: false CodeOpen sandbox tickPosition: change ticks position type: 'inner' | 'outer' | 'center' default: 'center' CodeOpen sandbox primaryTickLength: change primary ticks length type: number default: 5 primaryTickStyle: customise primary ticks style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox secondaryTickLength: change secondary ticks length type: number default: 3 secondaryTickStyle: customise secondary ticks style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox e. Ticks labels‚Äã tickLabelFormat: personlise the format of tick labels type: (x: number)=>string default: d3's smart tickFormat for time scale, String for others tickLabelStyle: change tick labels style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Introduction Next ParallelAxis Restriction Props 1. Axis Positon 2. Axis Range 3. Identify Axis 4. Choose Axis Behaviour 5. Personlise Axis

üè† Axes Introduction On this page Introduction Axes are one of the main component in react-plot There are currently 2 diffrent components to represent your Axes: Axis Parallel Axis They must be direct children of the Plot component and you may have many on the same plot. Default Axes‚Äã Adding any Series in your plot will create automatically the two basic axis CodeOpen sandbox Example‚Äã CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous RangeSeries Next Axis Default Axes Example

üè† Axes ParallelAxis On this page ParallelAxis ParallelAxis is a component used to create a parallel axis to an existed Axis, we must fix base axis id CodeOpen sandbox Props‚Äã 1. Identify Axis‚Äã id: mandoraty prop that specifie the base axis type: string 2. Choose Axis Behaviour‚Äã hidden: Hide all axis elements type: boolean default: false CodeOpen sandbox 3. Personlise Axis‚Äã a. Line‚Äã hiddenLine: Hide axis line type: boolean default: false lineStyle: change line style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox b. Label‚Äã label: Axis label type: ReactNode default: "" labelStyle: change label style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox c. Ticks‚Äã hiddenTicks: Hide axis ticks type: boolean default: false CodeOpen sandbox tickPosition: change ticks position type: 'inner' | 'outer' | 'center' default: 'center' CodeOpen sandbox primaryTickLength: change primary ticks length type: number default: 5 primaryTickStyle: customise primary ticks style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox secondaryTickLength: change secondary ticks length type: number default: 3 secondaryTickStyle: customise secondary ticks style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox d. Ticks labels‚Äã tickLabelFormat: personlise the format of tick labels type: (x: number)=>string default: d3's smart tickFormat for time scale, String for others tickLabelStyle: change tick labels style type: CSSProperties default: {} CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Axis Next Introduction Props 1. Identify Axis 2. Choose Axis Behaviour 3. Personlise Axis

üè† Getting Started Basics On this page Basics There are many component in react-plot divided to 5 basic categories in: Plot : the container of all other components Series : branch of components allow us to add diffrent Graphs Axes : component that represent plot axis Annotations : where we can add diffrent shapes to our plot Illustrations : allows to explain plot formmating Simple example‚Äã CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Installtion Next Plot Simple example
üè† Getting Started Installtion Installtion NPM‚Äã npm i react-plot Copy yarn‚Äã yarn add react-plot Copy Edit this page Previous Introduction Next Basics

üè† Hooks Basic On this page Basic Low level hooks used by other hooks but can also be used natively. currently we support the following basic hooks: useStartMoveEnd usePlotControllerAxes useStartMoveEnd‚Äã The low level hook useStartMoveEnd allows to track the mouse. It accepts 3 callbacks: onStart: the mouse was clicked onMove: the mouse was dragged onEnd: the mouse was released In the following example we simply log the different events. undefined CodeOpen sandbox usePlotControllerAxes‚Äã The low level hook usePlotControllerAxes allows to track axis state (max, min) after any modification. In the following example we simply log axes domain while using UseRectangularZoom. undefined CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Introduction Next Draw useStartMoveEnd usePlotControllerAxes

üè† Hooks Draw On this page Draw More advanced hook will not only monitor the movement of the mouse but will also return annotations that can directly be drawn in the Plot. currently we support the following drawing hooks: useDrawRectangle useDrawPath useDrawRectangle‚Äã There are 3 steps in order ot implement the draw rectangle: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: const drawRectangle = useDrawRectangle(); add the drawRectangle.annotations in order to draw the zoom rectangle: <Annotations>{drawRectangle.annotations}</Annotations> Draw a rectangle CodeOpen sandbox useDrawPath‚Äã There are 3 steps in order ot implement the draw path: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: const drawPath = useDrawPath(); add the drawPath.annotations in order to draw the path: <Annotations>{drawPath.annotations}</Annotations> Draw a path CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Basic Next Fonctional useDrawRectangle useDrawPath

üè† Hooks Fonctional On this page Fonctional These hooks allows you to do a specific precodeed functionalities currently we support the following functional hooks: useAxisZoom useRectangularZoom useAxisWheelZoom useCrossHair usePan useAxisZoom‚Äã This hook allows to zoom in a plot along the specified axis (default to horitzontal) while drawing a rectangle. There are 3 steps in order ot implement the zoom: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: const zoom = useAxisZoom({direction:'horizontal'}); add the zoom.annotations in order to draw the zoom rectangle: <Annotations>{zoom.annotations}</Annotations> This hook also implements the double click detection to reset the zoom to its original value. Draw a rectangle CodeOpen sandbox useRectangularZoom‚Äã This hook allows directly to manage the zoom in a plot. There are 3 steps in order ot implement the zoom: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: const zoom = useRectangularZoom(); add the zoom.annotations in order to draw the zoom rectangle: <Annotations>{zoom.annotations}</Annotations> This hook also implements the double click detection to reset the zoom to its original value. Draw a rectangle CodeOpen sandbox If a PlotController contains many Plot the change will be applied on all of them. Draw a rectangle Draw a rectangle CodeOpen sandbox useAxisWheelZoom‚Äã This hook allows to zoom in a plot along the specified axis (default to vertical) using mouse wheel. The hook may be customized with the following props: center : it define zoom center, used to choose a specific point or the mouse cursor "pointer" as zoom center type : number | "pointer" default : 0 factor : control zoom speed type : number default : "0" invert : invert wheel zooming (default wheel up will zoom in our plot) type : string default : false There are 2 steps in order ot implement the wheel zoom: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: useAxisWheelZoom({direction:'vertical', center:0, factor:1, invert:false}) This hook also implements the double click detection to reset the zoom to its original value. Scroll inside the plot CodeOpen sandbox useCrossHair‚Äã This hook adds crossHair to the plot . The hook may be customized with the following props: color : crossHair color type : string default : "black" lineStyle : add style to crossHair line type : CSSProperties default : {} textStyle : add style to crossHair text type : CSSProperties default : {} textTransform : trasform crossHair text type : string default : "" There are 3 steps in order ot implement the crossHair: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: const crossHair = useCrossHair(); add the crossHair.annotations in order to draw CrossHair: <Annotations>{crossHair.annotations}</Annotations> Move the mouse inside CodeOpen sandbox usePan‚Äã This hook adds an interactive pan to the plot to move in all direction while holding SHIFT. There are 2 steps in order ot implement the pan: wrap your plot component in <PlotController> add the hook: usePan(); This hook also implements the double click detection to reset the zoom to its original value. Press SHIFT & Grab and drag CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Draw Next Introduction useAxisZoom useRectangularZoom useAxisWheelZoom useCrossHair usePan

üè† Hooks Introduction On this page Introduction Draw a rectangle CodeOpen sandbox react-plot provides hook that allows to add functionalities to the plot. To benefit of those features the hooks have to be wrapped in a PlotController. Some hooks like useRectangularZoom will apply by default to all the Plot components contained in the PlotController. In the same page there may be many Plot components group in different PlotController components. Hooks‚Äã In order to understand hooks, we have divided them into three categories : Basic : low level hook helps to create your own functionalities Draw : allows you to draw in your plot Fonctional : precodded functionality Edit this page Previous Group Next Basic Hooks

üè† Illustrations Heading On this page Heading Heading represent the plot label TitleSubtitle CodeOpen sandbox Restriction‚Äã Plot can only have one Heading element Props‚Äã Mandatory‚Äã title: heading title text content type: string Optional‚Äã titleStyle: customise title style type: CSSProperties default: {} titleClass: add a class to the title type: string default: "" TitleSubtitle CodeOpen sandbox subtitle: heading subtitle text content type: string default: "" subtitleStyle: customise subtitle style type: CSSProperties default: {} subtitleClass: add a class to the subtitle type: string<br default: "" TitleSubtitle CodeOpen sandbox position: add a class to the subtitle type: 'top' | 'bottom'<br default: 'top' Top heading Bottom heading CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Introduction Next Legend Restriction Props Mandatory Optional

üè† Illustrations Introduction On this page Introduction This categorie used to imporve, explaine the Plot currently we support the following illusrations: Heading Legend Example‚Äã Graph HeadingSubtitle CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Fonctional Next Heading Example

üè† Illustrations Legend On this page Legend Legend is an component that describe each of Series of the Plot, it's also used to make interaction with them. CodeOpen sandbox Restriction‚Äã In order to add a Serie in Legend you must specifie it label It's not possible to set top and bottom, left and right offsets in the same time Props‚Äã position: determine Legend position in the plot type: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right'| 'embedded' default: 'embedded' embeded top bottom left right CodeOpen sandbox margin: add spacing out of legend type: number default: 10 CodeOpen sandbox onClick: Create a callback when clicking to one of legend elements, event: MouseEvent data, id: id of clicked serie type: (args: {event: React.MouseEvent<SVGGElement, MouseEvent>;id: string;}) => void labelStyle: change legend style in general or for specific serie's label type: CSSFuncProps default: {} lineStyle: change line style in general or for specific serie's label type: CSSFuncProps default: {} Click on legend series CodeOpen sandbox showHide: activate show/hide functionalit√© that allow you to hide and show series when clicking on it in the legend type: boolean default: false Click on legend series CodeOpen sandbox top change top legend offset that cannot defined with bottom type: number bottom change bottom legend offset that cannot defined with top type: number left change top legend offset that cannot defined with right type: number right change top legend offset that cannot defined with left type: number CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Heading Next Data Restriction Props

üè† Plot On this page Plot Plot is the container of all other component, and the main component in react-plot that create the plot svg CodeOpen sandbox Allowed children‚Äã Plot children must be one of the following components : Series components Axes components Annotations Heading Legend Props‚Äã Plot viewportSeries viewportWidthHeightMargin CodeOpen sandbox Mandatory‚Äã width: Width of the SVG in pixels type: number height: Height of the SVG in pixels type: number Optional‚Äã colorScheme: Color scheme used to pick colors for the series type: Iterable<string> default: "schemeSet1" from "d3-scale-chromatic" margin: Color scheme used to pick colors for the series type: {top?:number, bottom?:number, left?:number, right?:number} default: {} svgStyle: Style applied to the SVG element type: CSSProperties default: {} svgId: Id of the SVG element type: string default: generated automaticlly svgClassName: Class name of the SVG element type: string default: "" plotViewportStyle: Style applied to the rectangle around the entire plot type: CSSProperties default: {} seriesViewportStyle: Style applied to the rectangle around the series viewport type: CSSProperties default: {} controllerId: Id of the parent PlotController that will control this plot type: string default: "" Edit this page Previous Basics Next Introduction Allowed children Props Mandatory Optional

üè† Series BarSeries On this page BarSeries Display‚Äã CodeOpen sandbox Data‚Äã point type must extand from SeriesPoint Props‚Äã Like all other series, scatter series have Base props They also have many other props that we can class into the following categories : 1. Markers‚Äã displayMarkers: display scatter points markers type: boolean default: true markerShape: serie's markers shape type: Shape default: 'circle' markerSize: serie's markers size type: number default: 8 markerStyle: serie's markers style that can be dynamique or statique type: CSSFuncProps default: {} CodeOpen sandbox 2. Point Label‚Äã pointLabel: serie's point label that can be statique or dynamique depending points type: LabelFuncProps<point> default: '' pointLabelStyle: serie's point label style, statique or dynamique depending points type: CSSFuncProps<point> default: {} CodeOpen sandbox 3. ErrorBars‚Äã displayErrorBars: display errors bars in the serie type: boolean default: false errorBarsStyle: change error bars style type: SVGAttributes<SVGLineElement> errorBarsCapSize: size of error bars cap type: number errorBarsCapStyle: change error bars cap's style type: SVGAttributes<SVGLineElement> CodeOpen sandbox 4. Lines‚Äã lineStyle: styling of the serie's path statique or dynamique that depend series id type: CSSFuncProps<{id}> default: false CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous LineSeries Next FunctionSeries Display Data Props 1. Markers 2. Point Label 3. ErrorBars 4. Lines

üè† Series FunctionSeries On this page FunctionSeries Display‚Äã CodeOpen sandbox Restriction‚Äã You must specify the horizontal domain to use FunctionSeries otherwise the plot will not be displayed (next example) CodeOpen sandbox To set the horizontal domain use one of these options : Add horizontal Axis and determine max and min props<Axis min={0} max={20} position="bottom" /> Add another Series to the plot. It will automatically specify the domain of horizontal axis CodeOpen sandbox Data‚Äã In FuntionSeries we don't have data props we just need precise our function using getY callback Example:‚Äã We want to display y=f(x), which f is a declared function getY={(x)=>f(x)} CodeOpen sandbox Props‚Äã Like all other series, scatter series have Base props They also have many other props that we can class into the following categories : 1. Function‚Äã getY: (Mandatory) function that you want to display type: (x:number)=>number 2. Lines‚Äã lineStyle: styling of the serie's path statique or dynamique that depend series id type: CSSFuncProps<{id}> default: false CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous BarSeries Next RangeSeries Display Restriction Data Props 1. Function 2. Lines

üè† Series Introduction On this page Introduction There are currently 5 different kind of series that can be added in a plot: ScatterSeries LineSeries BarSeries FunctionSeries RangeSeries Series are direct children of the Plot component and you may have as many Series as you which on the same plot. Data‚Äã The main purpose of react-plot is displaying different data in many ways. Data is an array of points that differ from serie to another Base Props‚Äã They are the props that all series have: Mandatory‚Äã data: displayed serie's data type: Data Optional‚Äã id: serie id type: string default: generated automatically xAxis: series horizontal axis id type: string default: "x" yAxis: series vertical axis id type: string default: "y" label: label of the serie that can be displayed in legends type: string hidden: hide serie type: boolean default: false xShift: "number or string" type: number or string default: 0 yShift: "number or string" type: number or string default: 0 Example‚Äã CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Plot Next ScatterSeries Data Base Props Example

üè† Series LineSeries On this page LineSeries Display‚Äã CodeOpen sandbox Data‚Äã point type must extand from SeriesPoint Props‚Äã Like all other series, scatter series have Base props They also have many other props that we can class into the following categories : 1. Markers‚Äã displayMarkers: display scatter points markers type: boolean default: true markerShape: serie's markers shape type: Shape default: 'circle' markerSize: serie's markers size type: number default: 8 markerStyle: serie's markers style that can be dynamique or statique type: CSSFuncProps default: {} CodeOpen sandbox 2. Point Label‚Äã pointLabel: serie's point label that can be statique or dynamique depending points type: LabelFuncProps<point> default: '' pointLabelStyle: serie's point label style, statique or dynamique depending points type: CSSFuncProps<point> default: {} CodeOpen sandbox 3. ErrorBars‚Äã displayErrorBars: display errors bars in the serie type: boolean default: false errorBarsStyle: change error bars style type: SVGAttributes<SVGLineElement> errorBarsCapSize: size of error bars cap type: number errorBarsCapStyle: change error bars cap's style type: SVGAttributes<SVGLineElement> CodeOpen sandbox 4. Lines‚Äã lineStyle: styling of the serie's path statique or dynamique that depend series id type: CSSFuncProps<{id}> default: false CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous ScatterSeries Next BarSeries Display Data Props 1. Markers 2. Point Label 3. ErrorBars 4. Lines

üè† Series RangeSeries On this page RangeSeries Display‚Äã CodeOpen sandbox Data‚Äã point type must extand from RangeSeriesPoint Props‚Äã Like all other series, range series have Base props, and one more additional prop: lineStyle: style of range serie type: CSSProperties default: '' CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous FunctionSeries Next Introduction Display Data Props

üè† Series ScatterSeries On this page ScatterSeries Display‚Äã CodeOpen sandbox Data‚Äã point type must extand from SeriesPoint Props‚Äã Like all other series, scatter series have Base props, but in addition to that they also have many other props that we can class into the following categories : 1. Markers‚Äã displayMarkers: display scatter points markers type: boolean default: true markerShape: serie's markers shape that can be dynamique or statique type: ShapeFuncProps default: 'circle' markerSize: serie's markers size type: number default: 8 markerStyle: serie's markers style that can be dynamique or statique type: CSSFuncProps default: {} CodeOpen sandbox 2. Point Label‚Äã pointLabel: serie's point label (statique / dynamique) type: LabelFuncProps default: '' pointLabelStyle: serie's point label style (statique / dynamique) type: CSSFuncProps default: {} CodeOpen sandbox 3. ErrorBars‚Äã displayErrorBars: display errors bars in the serie type: boolean default: false errorBarsStyle: change error bars style type: SVGAttributes<SVGLineElement> errorBarsCapSize: size of error bars cap type: number errorBarsCapStyle: change error bars cap's style type: SVGAttributes<SVGLineElement> CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Introduction Next LineSeries Display Data Props 1. Markers 2. Point Label 3. ErrorBars

üè† Types Data On this page Data this type is used to define Series data type The used data must be extands from the following types: 1. SeriesPoint‚Äã Definition‚Äã In typescript : Array<{x:number,y:number}> Explication : Array of point, each point must have the two coordinates as a number, x in for horizantal Axis and y for vertical Axis Example : [ { x: 1, y: 1 }, { x: 2, y: 5 }, { x: 3, y: 3 }, { x: 4, y: 2 }, { x: 5, y: 1 } ] Utilities‚Äã This type is used in : ScatterSeries LineSeries BarSeries Example‚Äã CodeOpen sandbox 2. RangeSeriesPoint‚Äã Definition‚Äã In typescript : Array<{x:number,y1:number,y2:number}> Explication : Array of point, each point must have the three coordinates as a number, x in for horizantal Axis and y1,y2 to speficie the range for vertical Axis Example : [ { x: 1, y1: 0, y2: 2 }, { x: 2, y1: 2, y2: 3 }, { x: 3, y1: 3, y2: 4 } ] Utilities‚Äã This type is used in : RangeSeries Example‚Äã CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Legend Next ScalarValue 1. SeriesPoint Definition Utilities Example 2. RangeSeriesPoint Definition Utilities Example

üè† Types ScalarValue On this page ScalarValue This type is mainly used to allow more possibilities and ways to enter props We currently allow the following three types : 1. Number‚Äã Definition‚Äã In typescript : number Example : 3,5 Utilities‚Äã The value is converted using Axis scale Example‚Äã 2616 CodeOpen sandbox 2. Pixels‚Äã Definition‚Äã In typescript : '${number}' Explication : String number Example : '3','5' Utilities‚Äã The value is in pixels, independent from scale and Axis Example‚Äã 100px200px400px CodeOpen sandbox 3. Pourcentage‚Äã Definition‚Äã In typescript : '${number}%' Explication : String number ends with "%" Example : '3%','5%' Utilities‚Äã The value is converted depeding Axis domain Examples‚Äã 10%20%50% CodeOpen sandbox Edit this page Previous Data Next Infrared spectrum 1. Number Definition Utilities Example 2. Pixels Definition Utilities Example 3. Pourcentage Definition Utilities Examples
